channel.title: Motoring | Mail Online
channel.description: Check out the latest car and automotive news, tips and reviews from around the world from the Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday

item.title: Hoy back on two wheels! Olympian Sir Chris Hoy learns to drive a Nissan Juke on two wheels in just two days
item.description: Though now retired from professional cycling, the six-times gold medal winner has learned to drive a Nissan Juke on two wheels in just two days, rather than the two months experts say is normal.

item.title: Yodel delivery driver caught in video skidding his van around a roundabout
item.description: The video shows the driver leaving skid marks on the road while drifting around the roundabout between the busy Westwood Cross shopping centre and The Haine Road in Broadstairs, Kent.

item.title: Bugatti reveals new Chiron could take the title for the world’s fastest car
item.description: While technical details are sparse, the French car manufacturer claims it will be the 'world's most powerful, fastest, most luxurious and most exclusive production super sports car.'

item.title: Bugatti Veyron showroom offers £20k reward for catching hooded vandal
item.description: Bosses at Kahn Automobiles are offering a £20,000 reward for help catching a hooded vandal who smashed a Bugatti Veyron's windscreen with an iron bar at the dealership in Leeds.

item.title: Volvo unveils concept interior for its self-driving car with reclining seats
item.description: The Swedish company has named its design for self-driving cars 'Concept 26' which it says aims to put the joy back into driving by letting people make the most of commuting.

item.title: Range Rover rips the roof off its best-selling Evoque to produce the world's first compact 4x4 luxury cabriolet - for £50,000
item.description: The new Chelsea tractor is designed for fashionable, adventurous types who want wind-in-the-hair motoring.
item.media:description: ftr-RR_Evoque_Convertible_ext_dynamic (10).jpg

item.title: Chris Evans reviews Piaggio MP3 500 Sport: Fast, nimble, stable – and it scythes through rush-hour traffic
item.description: Oh, and by all means take a friend – there’s loads of room for a pillion and there are grab handles at the rear of the seat. Again, no additional qualification is required to carry a passenger.

item.title: Chris Evans reviews Seat Ibiza Connect 1.2 TSI: Everything about the new Ibiza is – well – just fine. But, oh, for a flash of originality and inspiration amid the bland efficiency
item.description: Sure, there’s good work in evidence but it’s all so derivative, so Audi, so VW, so keep it safe, so keep it in the family. Its crisp sharp lines doing nothing more than echoing those of the Audi A3 and VW Polo.

item.title: Chunky, economical and practical: A new model of Ignis is being unveiled at the Tokyo Motor Show
item.description: Eyes will turn East this month for the Tokyo Motor Show, where cars that will soon be on sale in Britain share space with some of the most outlandish designs on the planet.
item.media:description: ftr-Ignis 3.jpg

item.title: It's gull-winged, all-electric and might even come with a flux capacitor: Tesla unveils a new sports utility vehicle
item.description: Charge up your flux capacitors! We're going back to the future with Tesla Motors' unveiling of its gull-winged, all-electric sports utility vehicle.
item.media:description: September 29, 2015 - Fremont, California, United States: Elon Musk introduces Tesla's electric SUV, the Model X. (Scott Strazzante/San Francisco Chronicle/Polaris) / eyevine For further information please contact eyevine tel: +44 (0) 20 8709 8709 e-mail: info@eyevine.com www.eyevine.com

item.title: Land Rover Defender challenged Kahn Designs' 6-wheel monster for size
item.description: Dubbed the 'Flying Huntsman' by the team of British engineers who created it, the Defender Double Cab Pickup went on show at an exhibition in Peterborough earlier this month with more to follow.

item.title: Furious owners, retesting and betrayal: Ray Massey addresses the Volkswagen cheating scandal and its effects
item.description: What a week. And it's not over yet by a long chalk. The scandal sparked by Volkswagen caught cheating on its diesel emissions in America has a fair way to run

item.title: Ford's voice-recognition system understands accents across 17 different languages
item.description: The technology has been built into the Michigan-based car manufacturer's Sync systems and is powered by software built by Nuance.

item.title: Action Mobil Global XRS 7200 is ideal for people who like holidaying in warzones
item.description: The massive camper van, produced in Saalfelden am Steinernen Meer, Austria, has a 720-horsepower engine and comes with a £585,000 price tag.

item.title: Sporty, smart and turbocharged: Nissan's posher sibling Infiniti begins production of Q30 hatchback for autumn
item.description: For the British workers at the Nissan factory in Sunderland, it really will be 'to Infiniti and beyond' this autumn as the new upmarket Infiniti Q30 hatchbacks roll off the line and into showrooms.
item.media:description: Infiniti Q30 Concept, Frankfurt Motor Show 2013, embargo till 10th september 10:30 CET

item.title: Toyota celebrates 50 years of sales in Britain: From a few dealers importing cars from Japan to two local factories
item.description: Amazing to think that Toyota is celebrating its 50th anniversary of sales in Britain.
item.media:description: 2015-Auris-Hybrid-exterior-dynamic-17.jpg

item.title: BMW reveals eco-friendly i8 batmobile that can go 300 miles on a tank
item.description: The modified i8 coupe was developed with Toyota. It can travel 300 miles on one tank of hydrogen, with refueling taking about five minutes.

item.title: Renault to release new 'Kadjar', crossover vehicle, in hopes of drawing customers away from Nissan's top-selling Qashqai
item.description: French giant, Renault, will release new model to Brits in autumn although it will go on sale on the continent in the summer. Renault bosses say it's aimed at those with an adventurous spirit.
item.media:description: New RENAULT KADJAR

item.title: Ford's stupendous new GT supercar looks set to challenge Ferrari in the race for peak performance
item.description: The new model is predicted to sell for a quarter of a million pounds. The two-seater was designed by Scot Moray Callum and unveiled at the Detroit Motor Show ahead of going into production.
item.media:description: The new Ford GT is introduced at the 2015 North American International Auto Show in Detroit, Michigan, January 12, 2015. Ford plans to begin production of the supercar in 2016. AFP PHOTO/GEOFF ROBINS (Photo credit should read GEOFF ROBINS/AFP/Getty Images)

item.title: Star-studded car launches and jaw dropping stunts: Jaguar Land Rover shakes rivals with a display of cars from the Bond films
item.description: Jaguar Land Rover left its German rivals shaken and stirred with a star-studded James Bond car launch and a jaw-dropping stunt at this year's Frankfurt Motor Show.
item.media:credit: Getty Images for Jaguar Land Rov
item.media:description: FRANKFURT AM MAIN, GERMANY - SEPTEMBER 15: Naomi Harris ( James Bond Spectre, Miss Moneypenny ) next to a Jaguar C-X75 during the presentation of the Jaguar Land Rover vehicles starring in the new Bond film 'Spectre' on September 15, 2015 in Frankfurt am Main, Germany. (Photo by Gisela Schober/Getty Images for Jaguar Land Rover)

item.title: Powerful, luxurious and exclusive: New models by Rolls-Royce and Bentley lead the charge at next week's Frankfurt Motor Show
item.description: The world's two foremost luxury car makers, Rolls-Royce and Bentley, will lead the charge of top British marques at next week's Frankfurt Motor Show. Bentley this week unveiled its first 4x4.
item.media:description: 3 - Front Three Quarter Static 2.jpg

item.title: Reliable and fun, this 4x4 has got the phwoar factor! Jaguar unveils the F-PACE, its first family friendly sports car
item.description: Jaguar has unveiled its first sports utility 'crossover' vehicle, the F-PACE. The five-door five-seater is designed for families who need child seats in the back. It goes on sale next year, priced from £35,000.
item.media:description: ** EMBARGOED UNTIL 4 SEPT 03.00 BST ** / Jaguar FPACE / FAO Ray Massey / Source: Jon Morgan Jaguar UK PR M: +44 (0) 7823 363016 | Mobex: 871 27016

item.title: Dynamic, strong and sporty: Kia prepares to unveil fourth generation Sportage that takes cues from fighter jets
item.description: Growing families may be contemplating a bigger car as the summer holidays give way to 'back to school' - and work. Korean car company Kia is preparing to unveil its new fourth generation Sportage.
item.media:description: 1059671_All-New Kia Sportage (3).jpg

item.title: The cat's out of the bag: Ray Massey test drives Jaguar's unmistakably British-built next-generation steamlined sports saloon
item.description: Jaguar's elegant new products are leaping ahead to rival German companies such as BMW, Audi and Mercedes-Benz. The elegant new sports saloon XF is the latest to hit the road

item.title: Funky, Tardis-like and efficient: Honda announces prices for new hatchback supermini launching in September
item.description: Just in time for next month's new 65 plate, Honda has announced prices for its funky new third-generation Jazz, which goes on sale from £13,495.
item.media:description: 1046126_OKP-JAZZ-33.jpg

item.title: Volvo XC90 named Car Of The Year at the Auto Express Awards
item.description: Having test-driven one for a week, I'm impressed with Volvo's exceptionally striking, high-tech and nimble XC90 sports utility vehicle.

item.title: Maria Sharapova sparks 'car-wars' in a Porsche as Jaguar celebrates its first year as the official car of Wimbledon
item.description: As British Jaguars delivered guests to the annual WTA pre-Wimbledon Party, the Russian tennis star squeezed in a sneaky drive of the Porsche Boxter Spyder.
item.media:description: Maria Sharapova drops in at Porsche Mayfair to go for a spin in the UK's only brand new Porsche Boxster Spyder, on her way to the WTA Pre-Wimbledon Party at Kensington Roof Gardens.

item.title: Goodwood Festival of Speed begins on Thursday with more than 600 cars from past and present, including Honda Civic Type-R
item.description: The festival will feature cars from yesteryear, today and tomorrow. Since 1993 automotive extravaganza has become the nation's motor show. All major car makers brass will be attending.
item.media:description: Racy: The Honda Civic Type-R people?s supercar will be at the Goodwood Festival of Speed

item.title: Nissan takes over from Ford with new four-year deal as the main motoring sponsor of the UEFA Champions League
item.description: It's been an electric week for motoring. A fleet of 100 electric vehicles was ferrying VIPs at the UEFA Champions League in Berlin last Sunday where Spain's FC Barcelona triumphed over Juventus.
item.media:description: Nissan has taken over from Ford as the main motoring sponsor of the UEFA Champions League with a new four-year deal. All-electric Leaf ? built in Britain at the firm?s Sunderland factory.

item.title: MGs new Cumberhatch The suave British actor has been drafted in to be the company's face in the Far East
item.description: Cumberbatch was at the Shanghai Motor Show for the unveiling of the MG GS It will go on sale in Britain late next year.
item.media:description: Mandatory Credit: Photo by Stringer/REX_Shutterstock (4634556r) Benedict Cumberbatch in Shanghai, China - 11 Apr 2015 Benedict Cumberbatch at a press release of the MG new SUV

item.title: Feel that breeze: Ray Massey gets the roof off the new third-generation Audi TT Roadster 2.0 and puts it to the test
item.description: Ray Massey drove the fully stocked four-wheel-drive 2-litre TFSI, which was adept at whipping around the Cotswolds in style. The range starts at £31,995 and the Audi can cost as much as £50,000
item.media:description: Audi TT Roadster 2.0 TFSI S line Quattro (230PS) Price as driven: £54,180

item.title: SsangYong is launching a value for money five-door sports car from under £13,000
item.description: Korea's SsangYong is launching a new sports utility vehicle from under £13,000 that promises value for money motoring for drivers who believe in watching their pennies.
item.media:description: Korean SsangYong?s the new Tivoli, is a five-door family runaround

item.title: Honda makes a splash as it unveils new-look Civic prototype in garish green at the New York Motor Show
item.description: The good news is that the five-door hatchback version will be built exclusively at the Swindon factory. Honda announced the Wiltshire works would benefit from a £200million investment.
item.media:description:
New Honda Civic breaks cover. Five door version to be built in Britain and exported to the world - including Japan and USA.
By Ray Massey, Transport Editor
The new Honda Civic which the Japanese car firm?s UK factory in Swindon will be exporting to the world ? including Japan and the USA ? was unveiled in America tonight.
The wraps came off the prototype of the new 10th generation car at the New York International motor show.
It came just a day after it was announced that Swindon in Wiltshire will become the global production hub for the next generation five door Civic, supported by a new £200million investment.
Although the dramatic Kermit green prototype seen in New York is a three-door version, the Swindon factory will be exporting the five-door hatchback version around the globe. A Honda spokesman said: ?With more focus on sporty, fun-to-drive dynamics the new U.S. Civic line-up will include Civic saloon , Coupé and Si models, along with the return of the Civic five-door

item.title: Jaguar launches its new second-generation XF compact sports saloon with high-wire drive over London's Docklands
item.description: In a stunt worthy of the latest Bond film Spectre — for which the firm is supplying many of the cars — the XF (pictured) was revealed in a dramatic stunt high over the Royal Dock in Canary Wharf.

item.title: New 'green' BMW X5 xDrive40e can be recharged at home and switches between petrol and electric power while on the move
item.description: Just as George Osborne ratcheted up company car tax for thousands of motorists, German giant BMW unveiled its new 'budget buster' — its first mainstream plug-in petrol-electric hybrid SUV.
item.media:description: bmw.jpg

item.title: Mitsubishi's new XR-PHEV II prototype is selling fast as a company car thanks to it's massive tax advantages
item.description: The Outlander PHEV can be charged overnight at home, run on electric-only power or operate in hybrid mode, switching between petrol and electric power, depending on which is most efficient.
item.media:description: Mitsubishi?s Outlander - The prototype XR-PHEV (Plug-in Electric Vehicle) II

item.title: James Bond's favourite car-maker has unveiled the radical new family-friendly Aston Martin DBX at Geneva Motor Show
item.description: The new prototype is a two-door 'crossover' aimed at young families but the final version will be a four-door petrol-electric hatchback crossover. It includes a permanent integrated child seat.
item.media:description: Aston Martin DBX Concept Hand out image

item.title: Kia's third generation Sorrento brings a refreshing sense of reality
item.description: Amid all the fashion models and cars at the Paris motor show, Kia's sports utility vehicle turned heads. The seven-seater promises improved ride, handling and crash safety, writes RAY MASSEY
item.media:description: A Sorento, made by Korean car maker Kia is presented at the Paris Motor Show, in Paris, Thursday Oct. 2, 2014. The Paris Motor Show will open its doors to the public on Saturday Oct. 4, until Oct. 19. European carmakers are hoping to impress with new models at this week's Paris Motor Show and prove they have come out stronger from years of economic trouble and cost-cutting. (AP Photo/Remy de la Mauviniere)

item.title: Aston Martin to lead the British supercars at Geneva Motor Show next week with the new two-seater Vulcan
item.description: The new two-seater Aston Martin Vulcan will set you back £1.8million. The V12 engine is the equivalent of eight Ford Fiestas. The Vulcan will reach top speeds of 200mph and 0-60mph in three seconds.
item.media:description:
New Aston Martin Vulcan.
Hand Out Picture Ray Massey story
962419_Aston Martin Vulcan_01.jpg

item.title: Ford's fresher focus: Ray Massey test drives the new 5-door Focus Zetec
item.description: The company have put a great deal of attention to detail into the new model of the Zetec which is both effortless and nimble to drive. Ford have listened to their customers and simplified the car's interior.
item.media:description: Ford Focus Zetec

item.title: BMW's new compact people carrier, the 2 Series Gran Tourer, is the first premium compact to offer up to seven seats
item.description: Built with flexibility in mind, it also has a sliding second row of seats. There is a choice of five turbocharged petrol and diesel engines. It is also the only car in its class to team four wheel -drive with seven seats.
item.media:description: The new BMW 2 Series Gran Tourer - the first premium compact model to offer up to seven seats and fully meet the mobility requirements of young families.

item.title: I'm in eighth heaven! RAY MASSEY takes a look at the new Volkswagen Passat Estate
item.description: The Passat has been around for 42 years, the first model came out in 1973. The estate car is the fourth biggest-selling VW in the UK. The new model has keyless entry and heated seats.
item.media:description: Volkswagen Passat Estate SE Business 2.0 TDI car

item.title: Honda unveiled long awaited new NSX supercar this week at Detroit Motor Show
item.description: It's a petrol electric sport hybrid with aerodynamic low slung features. It has a combination of the 550bhp twin-turbo V6 engine at the rear and two of its three electric motors fixed on the axle towards the front.
item.media:description: New generation Honda NSX

item.title: The Skoda Fabia is named Car of the Year at awards ceremony organised by What Car?
item.description: The Czech company beat rivals BMW and Range Rover to win the title. The original Skoda Fabia won the award 15 years ago as well. Since VW took over the firm, Skoda has shed its joke reputation.
item.media:description: The Skoda Fabia 1.2 TSI 90 SE.

item.title: BMW to take extreme step and unveil the entire new range of next generation 6 series at North American International Auto Show
item.description: Including the new BMW 6 Series Convertible, Coupe and Gran Coupe. The cabriolet will go from rest to 62 mph in just 5.5 seconds. All petrol models will have a sports tuned exhaust system.
item.media:description:
BMW 6 Series Convertible:
BMW says it?s taking the extraordinary step of unveiling the entire range of its next generation 6-series in one fell swoop later this month at the North American International Auto Show in Detroit

item.title: The latest niche Mercedes is unveiled and will be on sale in the UK from June
item.description: It's Mercedes-Benz's its answer to rival BMW's X6 sports utility vehicle. It will be launched at the Detroit Motor Show next month. The new GLE Coupe is to get sporty styling and improved suspension.
item.media:description: New Mercedes-Benz GLE coupe red car

item.title: A new star on ice RAY MASSEY tests the new Land Rover Discovery Sport
item.description: RAY MASSEY tests the new Land Rover Discovery Sport on the snowy roads of Iceland. With an impressive seven seats avilable and fantastic flexibilty this car is perfect for families.
item.media:description: MINI Test Land Rover Discovery Sport with Daily Mail Motoring Editor Ray Massey in Iceland

item.title: Order books open for new Lexus RC F Coupe with powerful 471 bhp 5-litre engine
item.description: Acceleration from rest to 60mph in 4.5 seconds and a top speed of 168mph. The guiding principle, it says, was 'functional beauty'. The driver can also control wing deployment.
item.media:description: Lexus RC F coupe

item.title: The rebirth of the Vauxhall Viva as a frugal city car
item.description: The model hasn't been seen in 35 years. It will cost £7,000 and manage up to 70mpg. Its features include heated seats and steering wheel
item.media:description: New Vauxhall Viva car.

item.title: Mercedes-Benz unveil CLA Shooting Brake just in time for Christmas
item.description: Expect prices from around £25,500 to about £43,000 for the pumped-up CLA45 AMG, which will accelerate from rest to 62mph in 4.7 seconds, thanks to its 360 bhp, 2-litre turbo engine.
item.media:description: Mercedes-Benz CLA Shooting Brake (X117) 2014, jupiterrot, Studio

item.title: Suzuki Celerio goes on sale with stability control, alloy wheels and dual jet engine
item.description: Suzuki's new global city car offers very low CO2 emissions of 99g/km, 'class leading luggage capacity' of 254 litres and its AGS system also allows a low-speed 'creep' facility
item.media:description: Suzuki Celerio

item.title: Five-door hatchback Mazda2 named Car of the Year in its native Japan
item.description: Mazda promises great performance, economy, safety and driving fun when the supermini reaches Britain early next year, priced from around £13,000.
item.media:description: Mazda 2 motor car.

item.title: Great British Bake Off's Paul Hollywood starts London to Brighton veteran car run
item.description: The event marks Parliament allowing motorists to drive without a man waving a red flag ahead in 1896. Hollywood drove a two-seater 1904 De Dion-Bouton
item.media:description: Paul Hollywood will start the 2014 Bonhams London to Brighton veteran car run tomorrow. Hollywood will drive a two-seater 1904 De Dion-Bouton powered by a single-cylinder 6bhp engine loaned by the National Motor Museum, Beaulieu

item.title: Lexus NX 300h is quite a package says RAY MASSEY
item.description: More than 800 advance orders have been taken for the mid-sized, compact, petrol-electric crossover, costing from £29,495 for the entry level S version with front-wheel drive.
item.media:description:
New Lexus NX car.
- Ray Massey Story 900922_160914lex-c.jpg

item.title: Jaguar Land Rover unveils new XE sport at the Paris Motor Show
item.description: Land Rover Discovery Sport has also received 1,200 orders in three weeks. Chief executive Dr Ralf Speth said the cars are 'at the very heart of Britain's manufacturing renaissance'.
item.media:description: Rosie Huntington-Whiteley unveils the the new Land Rover Discovery Sport in Paris, France on an 80-metre barge on the River Seine ahead of the Paris Motor Show

item.title: Renault unveils the new Espace, an elegant crossover people carrier
item.description: The car is largely based on the concept car revealed a year ago and both the five and seven-seat versions are designed for greater flexibility.
item.media:description: Renault Espace

item.title: Honda HR-V combines coupe-like design with the versatility and stability of a 4x4
item.description: Honda has revealed its new compact sports utility vehicle — the HR-V — which goes on sale next summer from £16,000.
item.media:description: The new Honda HRV, costing £16,000

item.title: Jaguar's baby XE sport saloon arrives in a blaze of publicity
item.description: The XE, on sale next spring from £27,000, is Britain's challenger to Germany's big-selling BMW 3-series and is arguably the most important family car in the firm's history.
item.media:description: Jaguar XE sport saloon motor car.

item.title: Jaguar Land Rover launches the Discovery Sport with a 2.2-litre SD4 four-cylinder diesel engine
item.description: Priced from £32,395 to £42,995, the baby 'Disco' goes on sale in January alongside the existing full-size sevenseater Discovery.
item.media:description: New Land Rover Discovery Sport motor car. PR hand out images LR_DS_Iceland_Location_03.jpg

item.title: A cactus poised to bloom: RAY MASSEY takes the Citroen C4 Cactus Flair 1.6 Blue HDi 100 for a spin
item.description: This French back-to-basics family car combines simplicity and efficiency with practicality, low ownership costs and quirky looks. It also boasts a 1.6 litre HDi four-cylinder in-line turbodiesel engine.
item.media:description: Citroen C4 Cactus

item.title: A Bohemian Rhapsody: RAY MASSEY tests Skoda's third generation Fabia
item.description: The new model will be 17 per cent more economical than its predecessor. The Fabia is expected to go on sale in the UK early next year and will cost between £10, 000 and £16, 000.
item.media:description: Skoda Fabia

item.title: Volkswagen's sporty revised Scirocco is open for orders
item.description: Prices start at £20,455 on the road for the 1.4-litre TSI 125 PS manual and rise to £33,795 for the mean-looking 2-litre TSI 280 PS R. First UK deliveries will be in October
item.media:description: The new September?64? registration plate just a few weeks away, Volkswagen?s sporty revised Scirocco, pictured right, is open for orders. Prices start at £20,455 on the road for the 1.4-litre TSI 125 PS manual and rise to £33,795 for the mean-looking 2-litre TSI 280 PS R. First UK deliveries will be in October.

item.title: RAY MASSEY takes the Porsche Macan S for a spin
item.description: Recently voted Auto Express's best compact SUV of the year, the Porsche Macan S is priced from £43,000
item.media:description: Porsche Macan S

item.title: 'A scintillating and sophisticated drive': Ray Massey test drives the new Audi S3 cabriolet
item.description: The Audi S3 feels smart, comfortable, sporty and grown-up, but also great fun says RAY MASSEY. The stop-start system also switches off the engine to save fuel.
item.media:description: New Audi S3 Cabriolet. -no fee Audi handout- Ray Massey column.

item.title: Electric dreamland: Ray Massey test drives the BMW i8 electric hybrid
item.description: BMW's i8 electric hybrid has just gone on sale. It takes smugness to a new level, but also makes electric cars look and feel supercool. Batteries and a plug are included. Ray Massey gives his verdict.

item.title: Mazda 2 to hit showrooms this autumn, as sales of hot-hatch superminis soar
item.description: The Mazda 2 is the fourth member of a line-up that includes the CX-5 sports utility vehicle, the svelte Mazda 6 saloon and estate and the Mazda3 hatchback and fastback
item.media:description: Style and substance: Mazda says the new '2' promises performance, economy, safety and fun

item.title: Vauxhall is on a roll as they announce new super-mini
item.description: Vauxhall has just released details of the new, fifth-generation Corsa super-mini, set for its official launch at the Paris Motor Show in October
item.media:description: Supercar: Vauxhall's new, fifth-generation Corsa super-mini is set to launch in October

item.title: Ray Massey gets an exclusive drive in the Peugeot 2008 Hybrid Air
item.description: This week Ray Massey became the first British journalist to road-test the radical new family car that drives on air: the Peugeot 2008 Hybrid Air
item.media:description: Air power: The sports utility vehicle will be the first of a new generation of Peugeots and Citroens running on air

item.title: Living on the edge: Ford reveals new SUV
item.description: Ford unveiled its smart new Edge fiveseater sports utility vehicle this week. The Edge will go on sale here next year from around £30,000
item.media:description: Take five: Ford's all-new Edge fiveseater sports utility vehicle

item.title: Novak Djokovic helps Peugot launch new 508 model
item.description: Wimbledon top seed Novak Djokovic was in car mode this week to help Peugeot take the wraps off it new 508 model
item.media:description: Upmarket: Novak Djokovic with the Peugeot 508 at the French car firm's first global launch

item.title: Mini's first five-door hatchback
item.description: Promising more space, headroom, legroom and much greater ease of entry for rear passengers, it goes on sale in October from £15,900 to £20,050 on the road
item.media:description: Make room: The new Mini Promises more space, headroom and legroom

item.title: Ray Massey takes the MG3 3STYLE for a spin
item.description: It was with a sense of nostalgia that Ray jumped into the newest MG on the block — the MG3 five-door hatchback
item.media:description: Not bad for the cash: A nifty little commuter runaround if you're not too purist

item.title: Hyundai's iX factor: Ray Massey takes the iX35 for a spin
item.description: Ray Massey tests the Hyundai iX35 Premium 1.7 CRDI 2WD Manual, a car with kerb appeal
item.media:description: Ray Massey is impressed with the performance of the Hyundai iX35

item.title: Supercar buyers may as well be on a different planet
item.description: Mike Flewitt, chief executive of McLaren, was speaking this week about the challenge of keeping his international high-octane customers satisfied
item.media:description: McLaren 650S Ascari coupe: The company will bring out a new product every year

item.title: £500 million cash injection puts the spark back into Government electric car policy
item.description: A few weeks ago Ray branded the Government's electric car policy being in a mess. His Whitehall sources tell him it rattled cages at the Department for Transport.
item.media:description: A few weeks ago Ray branded the Government's electric car policy being in a mess. His Whitehall sources tell him it rattled cages at the Department for Transport.

item.title: A year ahead of launch Land Rover spotted sporting an offputting paint and trim
item.description: Land Rover is to create a baby version of its perennial Discovery. And more than a year ahead of its official UK launch, a disguised version of the Discovery Sport has been spotted on a British road, done out in somewhat offputting paint and trim.
item.media:description: Land Rover is to create a baby version of its perennial Discovery. And more than a year ahead of its official UK launch, a disguised version of the Discovery Sport has been spotted on a British road, done out in somewhat offputting paint and trim.

item.title: Ray Massey mini test: For the love of Adam
item.description: Motoring editor Ray Massey takes the Vauxhall Adam Glam 1.4i 16v VVT (87PS) (price as driven: £15,685) for a mini test and tells you the best and worst bits of his drive.
item.media:description: The Vauxhall Adam Glam 1.4i 16v VVT (87PS) (price as driven: £15,685)

item.title: Melanie Sykes picks up something petit and perky to zip around in
item.description: Melanie Sykes, who is the new presenter of BT Sport's MotoGP TV coverage, has opted for the nippy Fiat 500 super-mini convertible.
item.media:description: Fast lady motorsports commentator Melanie Sykes fancied something petit and perky with which to hit the road. And so the TV presenter and model has opted for the funky Fiat 500 super-mini convertible.

item.title: Maserati's 'bold start' to their centenary year
item.description: As Maserati marks its 100th year, you can expect to see the luxury car sponsoring exclusive events and opening new showrooms across the UK.
item.media:description: The drop-dead gorgeous Granturismo Sport

item.title: Ray Massey mini test: Cat with all the cream
item.description: Motoring editor Ray Massey takes the Jaguar F-Type R Coupe 5.0 litre V8 (from £85,000) for a mini test and tells you the best and worst bits of his drive.
item.media:description: Jaguar F-Type R Coupe 5.0 litre V8 (from £85,000)

item.title: Would you ADAM and Eve it: Singer VV Brown adds her own stylish touch tto Vauxhall's super-mini
item.description: She is known for her individual style, so it should come as no surprise that singer VV Brown has partnered with Vauxhall Motors to personalise and design her very own Vauxhall ADAM car.
item.media:description: Sound style: VV is known for her fashion forward looks which made her ideal to collaborate with Vauxhall Motors

item.title: Honda Civic Tourer 1.6 i-dTEC EX Plus diesel mini test by Ray Massey
item.description: Motoring editor Ray Massey takes the Honda Civic Tourer 1.6 i-dTEC EX Plus diesel (manual), £27,960 (price as driven) for a mini test and tells you the best and worst bits of his drive.
item.media:description: Honda Civic Tourer 1.6 i-dTEC EX Plus diesel (manual) Price as driven: £27,960

item.title: Are electric cars the future? Not if the government is in charge
item.description: Although Motoring Editor Ray Massey is a fan of electric cars, he has concerns over how practical they are.
item.media:description: Le charge: Electric cars, like this French version, will soon hit the streets of London

item.title: Ray Massey reports from the Geneva Motoring Show
item.description: Ray Massey, motoring editor, brings the news of the Geneva Motoring Show 2014. He reports on the latest Audi's birthday car and the outbreak of furnishing wars.
item.media:description: Happy returns: The new-look Audi TT

item.title: McLaren 650S Coupe
item.description: The McLaren 650S Coupe and open-topped Spider, with an electrically-retractable hardtop, make their global debuts on Tuesday at the Geneva Motor Show.
item.media:description: Speed demon: The new McLaren 650S

item.title: Ford Kuga 2.0 TDCi 163PS: Ray Massey reviews the latest Ford
item.description: The Ford Kuga 2.0 TDCi 163PS has a distinctive, yet handsome, contemporary, family-friendly crossover. Smart without being too flash.
item.media:credit: JK PRESS Ltd Pic Alex Alevroyiannis
item.media:description: Ford Kuga: Frugal but willing two-litre TDCi diesel engine develops 163bhp and is linked to an all-wheel-drive 'power-shift auto' six-speed automatic gearbox which helps keep driving fun and fuel bills down

item.title: Citroen Grand 4 Picasso: A French masterpiece
item.description: Motoring editor Ray Massey takes the new Citroen Grand 4 Picasso Exclusive e-HDi 115 Airdream for a mini test and gives you the lowdown.
item.media:description: Magnificent: Citroen Grand C4 Picasso Exclusive e-HDi 115 Airdream

item.title: Ray Massey on this week's Detroit Motor Show
item.description: The latest new Porsche roared into 'Motown' this week as all eyes turned to Detroit - the home of U.S. car-building, but a city that has known better times.
item.media:description: Setting the pace: The new 911 Targa Porsche offers the sensation of wind-in-the-hair driving

item.title: A great week for speed fans: Ferrari deliver 'superb levels of performance' and Jose Mourinho picks up the first Jaguar F-type coupe
item.description: The 200 mph California T is set to roar into Britain from September after its world debut at next month's Geneva Motor Show, whilst the Jaguar F-Type sports coupe was launched this week.
item.media:description: The turbocharged 200mph California T will arrive in Britain in September

item.title: Ray Massey: 'Cars made from 2011 onwards are among the worst for overstating the miles per gallon they achieve' Our motoring editor investigates
item.description: The second worst car was the Mercedes-Benz B-Class (2005- 2012) managing just 42.6 mpg compared with the claimed 59.6 mpg (71.8 per cent).
item.media:description: image001.png

item.title: There's never been a better time to buy a new car...unless you've got bad credit
item.description: As the new year plates arrive, car sales look set to flourish as people are enjoying PPI claim payouts and cheap credit.
item.media:description: The Ford Fiesta was a top seller in January

item.title: Citroen's Grand C4 Picasso is best in class for families
item.description: Ray Massey, motoring editor, gets to grips with the award-winning family car, Nick Clegg's push for electric cars and the biggest dangers on the road.
item.media:description: Prize winner: The Grand 4 Picasso

item.title: The new Lamborghini Huracán - a whirlwind of a car: Motoring news from Ray Massey
item.description: What better way to banish the blues than to contemplate - subject to a lottery win - having some fun behind the wheel of the new Lamborghini Huracán?
item.media:description: A beast: The car's engine has about the same bhp as half-a-dozen Ford Fiestas

item.title: The new Nissan Qashqai: It's second to none
item.description: This is the second generation of the family car that broke the mould and helped create a whole new segment of 'crossover' vehicles, which put a 4x4 shape on the frame of a hatchback.
item.media:description: Good looks, strong stance, plus practical design and execution. Will Sunderland be able to keep pace with demand?

item.title: Peugeot 308 'Feline': The year of the cat: Why the new Peugeot 308 'Feline' is a cracking way to accelerate into the New Year
item.description: Nifty, nimble and willing 1.6-litre 156 bhp petrol engine linked to a smooth six-speed manual gearbox, which helped propel the car from rest to 62 mph in just 8.2 seconds.
item.media:description: New Peugeot 308 'Feline': Handsome, sober styling with a nose and grille that looks a little like a Mercedes-Benz. That fits with Peugeot's intention to go more upmarket

item.title: Mercedes-Benz's C-class saloon to set new standards for cars of its kind
item.description: Just in time to add to your New Year wish list comes Mercedes-Benz's latest version of its C-Class compact saloons. And what a high-tech feast it is.
item.media:description: High-tech feast: Mercedes-Benz's latest C-class compact saloon

item.title: First woman to lead a major car-maker appointed chief executive of General Motors
item.description: Mary Barra, an engineer and mother of two teenagers, became the most powerful woman in the motor industry this week.
item.media:description: Lifer: Barra joined GM aged 18 and has risen through the ranks over 33 years

item.title: New Ford Mustang revealed with the help of Sienna Miller
item.description: Never mind Mustang Sally. It was more 'Mustang Sienna' as the actress Sienna Miller helped the global launch of the latest classic Ford Mustang.
item.media:description: Ford Mustang collaboration with Sienna

item.title: Ray Massey explores the ins-and-outs of the new Honda Civic Tourer
item.description: Order books are now open for the new British-built Honda Civic Tourer with the first deliveries set to reach UK showrooms from February.
item.media:description: Honda Civic Tourer: Includes new safety and road-holding technology

item.title: Jaguar F-type coupe upstages Simon Cowell during its Los Angeles motor show debut
item.description: The X Factor boss might have been holding court in Los Angeles but for motoring editor Ray Massey, nothing could upstage the Jaguar F-type.
item.media:description: The range-topping £85,000 F-Type R Coupe is powered by a five-litre supercharged 550 bhp V8 engine, propelling it from rest to 60 mph in just four seconds

item.title: Truly electric! Ray Massey tests the BMW I3 REX 'Range Extender'
item.description: It's not every day I get a police escort down The Mall from Buckingham Palace. But I did - well, sort of - in this head-turning electric car from BMW.
item.media:description: Devilish fun: With its rocket-like acceleration, you quickly forget this is an electric car

item.title: Nissan's Qashqai is just one step away from self-driving car
item.description: Most of the hi-tech kit needed for the car to drive itself — from self-parking to collision avoidance — is already hard-wired into the new version.
item.media:description: The second-generation Qashqai crossover comes equipped with a host of features more usually seen on luxury vehicles

item.title: Audi RS 7 Sportback review: A well-bred beast says RAY MASSEY
item.description: The Sportback is a racy, stylish, 189mph supercar for grown-ups who want power and pace with minimal bling.
item.media:description: A racy, stylish supercar for grown-ups: Audi RS7 Sportback

item.title: Twelve drivers put pedal to the metal as they set the world record for the fastest 24-hour car ride
item.description: Let's hear it for 12 plucky drivers who drove for 24 hours at an average speed of 125 mph in British-built Vauxhall Astra hatchbacks.
item.media:description: Vauxhall Astra

item.title: Skoda Yeti: Getting to grips with a Yeti
item.description: Skoda is about to launch the second generation of its popular crossover sports utility vehicle. The first generation has already proved a big hit.
item.media:description: Two versions of the new Yeti are available for the first time - the standard and the more rufty-tufty Outdoor

item.title: Ray Massey's Mini test: Join posh van club with Mercedes-Benz Viano CDI Ambiente
item.description: This is not so much a van as a luxurious business-class aircraft cabin on wheels. I had to ferry three adults, two growing teenagers, and luggage.
item.media:description: Posh man van: The Mercedes-Benz Viano 3.0-litre CDI Ambiente

item.title: AeroSeven gets futuristic new look
item.description: Production versions will be built at the British sports car maker Caterham's factory in Dartford, Kent, ready for launch next year — with many being made for export.
item.media:description: The AeroSeven draws heavily on F1 team technology and will be the first Caterham to be fitted with traction control

item.title: Smitten with the bug: RAY MASSEY tests the Volkswagen Beetle Cabriolet
item.description: It’s no slouch. On Germany’s unrestricted motorways, it’ll cruise happily and legally top-down in the ‘slow’ lane at 100 mph.
item.media:description: The dashboard combines useable hi-tech with a touch of retro. The sat-nav worked like a dream and got me along the Baltic to the beautiful islands and coastal resorts near the Polish border, and back, with ease

item.title: Citroen's new eye-catching family car is cheerful but not cheap
item.description: RAY MASSEY: The first things to catch the eye are the curious blisters of air-filled plastic, which adorn the sides of the door and bodywork.
item.media:description: French giant Citroen describe their new C4 Cactus as a car which 'sheds the superfluous' and eliminates unnecessary and fiddly knobs and buttons

item.title: Mercedes-Benz reveals its first-ever compact SUV, the aerodynamic GLA
item.description: All roads lead to Germany next week as the Frankfurt Motor Show gets under way. Mercedes-Benz will be showing off its first-ever SUV.
item.media:description: New Mercedes-Benz GLA

item.title: The ultimate off-road experience? Ray Massey drives the new Range Rover Sport through a decommissioned Boeing 747
item.description: My test drive of the new Range Rover Sport was exacting enough, before I tackled the decommissioned jumbo at Cotswold Airport, near Cirencester, Glos.
item.media:description: The ultimate off-road experience? Ray Massey drives the new Range Rover Sport through a decommissioned Boeing 747

item.title: Happy birthday! The Porsche 911 turns 50 this month
item.description: Earplugs ready! German sports car meister Porsche and the Goodwood Festival of Speed are revving up for their birthdays this month. Porsche will mark the 50th anniversary of its classic 911.
item.media:description: Porsche will mark the 50th anniversary of its classic 911

item.title: Firm hopes their new compact Mazda 3 saloon will rival the Volkswagen Golf
item.description: Japan's Mazda unveiled its new five-door small family hatchback simultaneously in five locations across the globe this week - including Britain.
item.media:description: The Mazda 3 is is powered by a new, superfrugal 99bhp 1.5-litre Skyactiv-G petrol engine that takes it from rest to 62 mph in 10.8 seconds

item.title: Aston Martin set to launch 'no compromise' £200,000 flagship soft-top convertible
item.description: That rare shaft of sunshine this week was enough for British supercar-maker Aston Martin to launch a blistering £200,000 flagship soft-top, a highlight of its centenary year.
item.media:description: The new Vanquish Volante is the first with an alllightweight, but super-strong, carbon-fibre body

item.title: BMW has high hopes for the new generation of its X5 off-roader
item.description: The luxury 4x4, which BMW dubs a sports activity vehicle, broke cover this week. It goes on sale here in November, writes RAY MASSEY.
item.media:description: German car giant BMW has high hopes for the new generation of its X5 off-roader

item.title: Ray Massey mini test: The Peugeot 208 GTI is a dream re-hatched
item.description: The Peugeot 205 GTi became an icon of the Eighties. Now, almost three decades on, comes what Peugeot believes is its true spiritual successor - the 208 GTi, writes RAY MASSEY.
item.media:description: Peugeot 208 GTi is nippy around town with a handy burst of acceleration up to 30mph

item.title: Road craters drive you mad? New Mercedes-Benz limousine scans road surface to brace itself prior to impact
item.description: Mercedes-Benz' new flagship S-Class limousine, pictured, could be the cleverest car on the road; it can 'see' potholes and bumps ahead, writes RAY MASSEY.
item.media:description: Mercedes-Benz S 350 BlueTec is super intuitive

item.title: Ray Massey mini test: Room for one more KIA Carens '3' 1.7 CRDi manual
item.description: It is a truth universally acknowledged that a growing family must be in want of a multi-purpose car, writes RAY MASSEY of the £23,895 KIA Carens '3' 1.7 CRDi manual.
item.media:description: The Carens is the last Kia to have been re-styled by design chief Peter Schreyer

item.title: Ray Massey: Britain's legendary Land Rover gears up for its 65th anniversary celebrations
item.description: The British car maker is marking its big day with a striking display of its heritage and future technology, proving that although it's 65, the car won't be pensioned off.
item.media:description: Land Rover

item.title: Ray Massey: Peugeot gears up for launch of its new 2008 urban crossover
item.description: The French maker promises up to 61.8 mpg from the car, which was unveiled at the recent Geneva Motor Show.
item.media:description: Peugeot is gearing up for the June launch of its new 2008 urban crossover

item.title: RAY MASSEY mini test: High marks in French
item.description: French car-maker Citroen has piled in with a practical five-seater cabriolet that allows the whole family to enjoy wind-in the-hair motoring, writes RAY MASSEY.
item.media:description: Citroen has piled in with a practical five-seater cabriolet that allows the whole family to enjoy motoring

item.title: RAY MASSEY mini test: This is one hot cat
item.description: Jaguar's sexy new F-type sports car hit the road this week and from my exclusive first drive, I can tell you that the cat has got the cream, writes RAY MASSEY.
item.media:description: Ray Massey, from his exclusive first drive of the Jaguar F-type sports car, says the cat has got the cream

item.title: Ray Massey test-drives the stunning new Jaguar F-Type roadster over more than 200 miles- on roach and track- in Navarre, Northern Spain
item.description: Ray Massey test out the sexy new Jaguar F-type sports car, which has a top speed of 186mph and will accelerate to 60mph in just 4.2 seconds.
item.media:description: The automatic gear system will even recognise when car is repeatedly overtaking - and keep it in a lower gear for added acceleration

item.title: Ray Massey test drives the new Toyota GT 86 car
item.description: It has classic sporty looks, a spirited driving performance and is an engaging Toyota to suit carefree, boy racers now with families in tow.
item.media:description: Value? The Toyota GT 86 car, starts at £27,995, but extras such as heated seats quickly rack up a larger bill

item.title: Table manners please! Motor-bike champion's table-top ride takes the biscuit at the stately home of dashing speed-king Lord March
item.description: RAY MASSEY: As controversial table-manners go, it certainly beats resting on your elbows. This remarkable stunt came as the dashing Earl of March hosted a sumptuous sponsors and press dinner.
item.media:description: Motorcycle ace and 12 times world trials champion Dougie Lampkin slipped quietly away from the table

item.title: Nissan turns over a new LEAF: Japanese manufacturer unveils its redesigned electric car which promises to end 'range anxiety'
item.description: With a longer range, lots of extra space and a heavier steer, the Nissan LEAF might be small but it drives like one of the big boys - and that's no bad thing.
item.media:description: Eco chic: The sleek new Nissan LEAF has plenty of space and handles like a dream

item.title: First drive: Behind the wheel of the astonishing fuel-slashing 313mpg Volkswagen that could put tax grabbing Chancellor - and a few filling stations - out of businesses
item.description: Mailonline has had an exclusive first drive of the astonishing new ‘green’ super-frugal car offering 2p a mile motoring that could swiftly put Osborne and the Treasury out of business.
item.media:description: With the average cost of diesel at £1.46 per litre - £6.64 per gallon this little beauty could in theory when driven most efficiently get you the 876 mile length of the United Kingdom for under £20

item.title: We're all dreaming of a supercar future: Aston Martin and McLaren lead the way as Brits' fantasy wheels
item.description: What would you splash out on if your numbers came up? According to new research, for British car fans, nothing but a Bentley will do.
item.media:description: Four built-in Britain brands made the top ten - Aston Martin, Bentley, Jaguar and McLaren (pictured)

item.title: Ray Massey brings MailOnline an exclusive sneak peak of the cars of the future as the Future Drive Motor show revs up for its launch this Spring
item.description: Major car makers including Vauxhall, Nissan, Citroen and Volvo will exhibit a range of their latest and yet to launch vehicles as well as providing test drives at the Future Drive Motor Show.
item.media:description: future drive show

item.title: Continental GT Speed: Bentley unveils what is claims is the world's fastest four-seater covertibel
item.description: It will be in showrooms this spring, priced at £160,000, following its global unveiling at the Detroit Motor Show on January 14. Bentley describes it as its ' performance flagship convertible'.
item.media:description: Bentley GT Speed: The ultimate in wind-in-your-hair motoring

item.title: RAY MASSEY: Skoda to launch car with 'middle-class qualities at a compact car price'
item.description: Production of the third generation Octavia started this month at the Mlada Boleslav plant in the Czech Republic, ahead of its March launch in Britain.
item.media:description: Skoda's next-generation Octavia family hatchback is aimed squarely at motorists demanding ever more value for money

item.title: Audi launch family car that's believed to be the world's fastest estate
item.description: It accelerates from rest to 62 mph in 3.9 seconds and will cost around £77,000 when in showrooms early next year (for delivery in summer).
item.media:description: The powerful new R S6 Avant is believed to be the world¿s fastest estate

item.title: RAY MASSEY: The Honda CR-V is the best 4x4 so far
item.description: This is the fourth generation of the Honda CR-V, which has established itself as a mainstay of Middle Britain for adaptable family transport since the first generation arrived in Europe in 1997.
item.media:description: Honda CR-V 2.0 i-VTEC EX 4WD Automatic is the best 4x4 says Ray

item.title: RAY MASSEY: Sixteen will soon be able to drive to school on an updated moped
item.description: The Aixam Coupe S (pictured) may look like a compact city car, but it is classed as a ‘light quadricycle’, which can be driven with a moped licence.
item.media:description: The Aixam Coupe S may look like a compact city car, but it is classed as a 'light quadricycle', which can be driven with a moped licence

item.title: Britain's cheapest car the Dacia Sandero goes on sale for just £6,000
item.description: Start queuing for the Dacia Sandero - it’s Britain’s cheapest car at less than £6,000. Renault bought the Romanian car-maker in 1999 as its ‘budget’ brand and the UK market is the final piece of the jigsaw.
item.media:description: The Dacia Sandero, from £5995 is Britain's cheapest car

item.title: WORLD EXCLUSIVE: MailOnline's Ray Massey tests James Bond 007's new Range Rover before Daniel Craig in Skyfall
item.description: James Bond star Daniel Craig performed a top secret mission right under the noses of the world's media at this week's royal global premier of the latest 007 movie, Skyfall, which goes on general release today.
item.media:description: WORLD EXCLUSIVE: The name's Rover, Range Rover: Ray Massey takes 007's new wheels out for their first ever spin (before even James Bond himself)

item.title: RAY MASSEY: California dreaming with the new Volkswagen Beetle Cabriolet
item.description: I love the look of the new Volkswagen Beetle Cabriolet which makes its world debut at the Los Angeles Motor Show on November 28 and will go on sale in Britain in spring.
item.media:description: Volkswagen Beetle Cabriolet VW

item.title: Lana del Rey unveils Jaguar's flashy new F-Type sports car
item.description: Sultry pop star Lana del Rey took the wraps off Jaguar's flashy new F-Type sports car, pictured right, as a string of new British vehicles stole the Paris Motor Show from under the noses of the French this week.
item.media:description: Lana Del Rey shows some leg as she helps launch Jaguar's latest luxury car

item.title: Volvo with va-va voom
item.description: The smart new Volvo V40 is the Swedish maker's first foray into the competitive upmarket family hatchback arena.
item.media:description: Volvo V40 D4 SE Lux Nav Price as driven: £33,500

item.title: Toyota goes bolder and sleeker with new Auris
item.description: Toyota has sent its British-built family car to boot camp. The result is a toned-up, better performing model.
item.media:description: The new Auris will be unveiled at next month's Paris Motor Show in a bid to challenge rivals such as the Volkswagen Golf and Ford Focus

item.title: Welcome home the car that beat the Nazis to Olympic gold in 1936
item.description: A British sports car, whose determined lady driver beat the Nazis to win Olympic gold at the Berlin Games of 1936, has revved into London 2012.
item.media:description: The 'Singer' Le Mans sports which won Gold in the Olympic Motor Rally 1936 in Berlin on show outside the Savoy hotel in London, pictured with Savoy representative Anna Sebastian. Picture David Parker 26.7.12 Reporter Ray Massey

item.title: Alfa turns up the heat with the latest model
item.description: Ray Massey does a mini test drive on the latest model and he is impressed by the sporty style of the new Alfa Romeo Giulietta 1.4 TB MultiAir 170bhp TCT Veloce.
item.media:description: Alfa Romeo Giulietta 1.4 TB MultiAir 170bhp TCT Veloce. Price as driven: £26,555

item.title: RAY MASSEY: Vauxhall unveils cute city car
item.description: In its quest to become more Motoring upwardly mobile and cool, Vauxhall has unveiled its new small, but perfectly formed, upmarket urban runaround called . . . Adam.
item.media:description: The Vauxhall Adam is set to hit our showrooms in January

item.title: Ray Massey: Mad for a Mazda
item.description: This cat is so easy to live with, I grew into it like a much-loved jacket. Driving it quickly became second nature.
item.media:description: Mad for a Mazda: Test driving the latest model

item.title: Ray Massey: Mercedes-Benz unveiled its svelte and sporty new CLS, a style that owes its heritage to hunting
item.description: It's not every day an international luxury car company holds the global launch of its latest model in Britain — and brings over its top brass to do the honours.
item.media:description: The new svelte and sporty CLS model

item.title: Motoring ahead... now China's super-rich top Bentley-buying league
item.description: It is the first time China has led the Bentley sales table, a landmark that will be seen as another sign of a new world economic order.
item.media:description: Growing market: A Chinese model poses beside a Bentley luxury car at the Beijing Motor Show - the iconic Bentley is no longer just a Western status symbol ¿ this year, more of the luxury vehicles have been sold to China than anywhere else in the world

item.title: Millionth Land Rover Discovery rolls off the production line to explore new challenges
item.description: Beloved of intrepid explorers and school run mums alike, the one millionth Land Rover Discovery rolled off the production line today before embarking on an epic 8,000 mile fund-raising expedition miles to China.
item.media:description: From left: Explorers Ben Saunders, Ray Mears (front), Monty Halls, Bear Grylls and Sir Ranulph Fiennes with the one millionth Land Rover Discovery

item.title: Jaguar puts the boot in with new XF Sportbrake estate
item.description: The new British-built 150mph Jaguar XF Sportbrake is set to be one of the stars of next week’s Geneva Motor Show when it is officially unveiled – as well as making shopping trips rather more fun.
item.media:description: The new British-built 150mph Jaguar XF Sportbrake is set to be one of the stars of the Geneva Motor Show

item.title: Jobs boost for Jaguar Land Rover as Indian owners double investment to £1.5bn a year
item.description: The extra cash injection and prospect of thousands of new jobs comes as the firm is set to announce Jaguar and Land Rover production in booming China.
item.media:description: Magazine: Autocar has uncovered a secret 'baby' Jaguar project. It yesterday emerged that Jaguar Land Rover is set for another jobs boost as its Indian owners announced a doubling of investment to £1.5billion a year to fund a range of new models

item.title: Nick Reilly, President of General Motors Europe, retires after nearly 40 years
item.description: There was a touching farewell at the RAC Club in Pall Mall, London, to a much-loved and well-respected motor industry boss who really has put his own money where his mouth is.
item.media:description: The president of General Motors Europe, Nick Reilly, is retiring
